data.text: As for the ungodly, wrath came upon them without mercy unto the end:
How that having given them leave to depart,
For while they were yet mourning
For the destiny, whereof they were worthy, drew them unto this end,
And that thy people might pass through a wonderful way:
For the whole creature in his proper kind was fashioned again anew,
As namely, a cloud shadowing the camp;
Through which all the people went that were defended with thy hand,
For they went at large like horses,
For they were yet mindful of the things that were done while they sojourned in the strange land,
But afterward they saw a new generation of fowls,
For quails came up unto them from the sea for their contentment.
And punishments came upon the sinners
For the Sodomites did not receive those, whom they knew not when they came:
And not only so, but peradventure some respect shall be had of those,
But these very grievously afflicted them,
Therefore even with blindness were these stricken,
For the elements were changed in themselves by a kind of harmony,
For earthly things were turned into watery,
The fire had power in the water, forgetting his own virtue:
On the other side, the flames wasted not the flesh of the corruptible living things,
For in all things, O Lord, thou didst magnify thy people, and glorify them,
